subject: Programming
title: Big Design Up Front
description: A quick, practical guide to Big Design Up Front.

hook.text: Design the entire system architecture before writing code. No surprises. No wasted effort.

buildup.text: BDUF produced thick design documents with every class, table, and interface specified.

discovery.text: Detailed designs prevented costly mistakes in hardware-intensive systems where changes were expensive.

twist.text: In software, change is cheap â€” or should be. Designs locked in assumptions that proved wrong.

climax.text: Agile taught us to design just enough to start, then let the architecture emerge from real use.

punchline.text: Plans are useful. Rigid plans are dangerous.

quiz.question: What is a major drawback of Big Design Up Front?
options: It locks in assumptions that may prove wrong
